message:
For non-embedded engineers.
Have you written anything before in C/CPP in your company ?

data.message: no, but there is plenty to be written
even if it's not used in egypt
I use Go if I want something fast.
No body in egypy work at this level...
Outside?
I think there's a few that works in graphic field..  Like 360 imagining
I have worked in computer vision and game programming, and currently doing embedded software
Yes computer vision, native extensions for Adobe air , and a USB device driver ... Much more to be said
Yeah, my first job was for a company making distributed storage software. It was written in C++ and Python
yes, before and my current job is primarily in C++
Was that in Egypt ?! (for all above friends)
Worth mentioning I worked with Ahmed Soliman Farghal on that project I spoke about. I miss those days man :)
Rafael Adel Yes
That's great though. Never thought such languages are used in fields other than embedded systems here in Egypt.
We used C++ at NTPSoftware to develop storage management solutions.
Does desktop applications that serves other Embedded applications count?
That was 8 years ago when we tried to write some server app in CPP and we failed due to lack of experience , then the decision was to write it in python and we got wonderful result asap

yes, C++ is still being used widely in all high performance projects in many companies ( only few in Egypt ), either for desktop apps, or as back-end process for web apps ( by big companies , facebook ..etc ). I have been writing C++ for the last 10 years at NTP Software from USA (home based )

لما بدأت برمجة من 11 سنة, بدأت في شركة بتعمل برامج هندسة مدنية, كنا شغالين C++ و VB.NET, في نفس الشركة كان فيه مشاريع شغالة Visual C++
بعد كده اتنقلت لشركة كانوا شغالين Visual C++ و C#, و دول كانوا بيعملوا برامج بتخدم في مجال الاتصالات
الشركات دي مكملة بنفس التقنيات اللي كانوا شغالين بيها
و فيه كان فيه شركات تانية شغالة C++ عادي جدا
أشطر مبرمجين شفتهم اللي بدأوا حياتهم المهنية C++
 و أسوأ مبرمجين شفتهم اللي بدأوا حياتهم vb6 أو asp.net webforms
تعلم اللغتين دول بالذات بيفرق كتير جدا لو هاتشتغل في enterprise applications بغض النظر عن اللغة اللي هاتكتب بيها بعد كده
Yes, we used C before in Bibliotheca Alexandrina, the code is even open source.
